title: If a retailer offers a discount of 50% on the marked price of his goods and thus ends up selling at cost price, what was the % mark up? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you markup your goods by >100% and sell at 50% discount, you are the difference E.g 10rs cost of pen. marked up it by 110% i.e by 11 rs. Now selling price is 21 rs. Discount given 50% on 21 rs. Which sold at 10.50 rs. So, 0.5 paisa is profit. So, for giving 50% dis and earn money. Use 100%+profit%.
Let : CP = 100 MP = 100x Discount = 50% = 50x SP = MP - Disc = 50x But, CP = SP => 100 = 50x => x = 2 => Cost Price must be marked up 100% :-)
